alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 1:34AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS, SNOW AND RAIN THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... A strong area of low pressure moving into the Susitna Valley from the Kenai Peninsula will bring a combination of strong winds, snow, and rain to the Matanuska Valley tonight through tomorrow morning. Expect wind gusts of 45 to 60 mph through 4 AM Sunday as the area of low pressure moves through the area. Winds will then shift to the south and diminish through Sunday morning as the low moves north. A mix of rain and snow is expected with 2 to 6 inches possible at lower elevations and up to 8 possible at higher elevations near Hatcher Pass and Sutton. Totals will be highly dependent on duration of any rain and/or mixed precipitation.
